content: vertexReplace here now uses an ite tree, and all the proofs are shorter. But cliqueFree_of_vertexReplace_cliqueFree is still quite long and I would appreciate any golfs of it

In particular I'm looking for a better way to define the clique at https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/6808/files#diff-dc91977ea4400eedf346f043f4052ffe557a66895e41eab4965f7a9974e43d7eR254 and prove it has the required property
Surely there's a declaration saying that replacing one in/out pair of an injective function (where the new output is not in the original range) is still injective?
